H0.text: Electroluminescence is the process by which a neon light produces visible light.

H1.text: Luminescence is the process by which a neon light produces visible light.

H2.text: Radiation is the process by which a neon light produces visible light.

H3.text: Mitosis is how a neon light produces visible light.

A4.text: Unlike neon and fluorescent lamps, EL lamps are not negative resistance devices so no extra circuitry is needed to regulate the amount of current flowing through them.

A5.text: Electroluminescence is the result of radiative recombination of electrons and holes in a material, usually a semiconductor.

A6.text: The lamp glow discharge lights at its striking voltage.

A7.text: The glowing portion in the lamp is a thin region near the cathode.
